verbs.description: minimize (third-person singular simple present minimizes, present participle minimizing, simple past and past participle minimized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make (something) smaller or as small as possible; shrink; reduce.
examples: We have to minimize the budget.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To relegate or assign (something) to a less insignificant status; diminish.
examples: The insurance adjuster tried to minimize the extent of the damage to lessen the company's exposure to liability.

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive, graphical user interface) To remove (a window) from the main display area, collapsing it to an icon or caption.
examples: I didn't close anything, but I minimized all the windows so I could see the desktop.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To treat (someone) in a slighting manner.
